result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Fallon C. Thomas is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

On one or more charges in this case, Fallon C. Thomas was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Fallon C. Thomas in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Defendant Fallon C. Thomas in custody.  
Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing on conditional release plan held.  The Court found the defendant not guilty by reason of mental disease/defect on 11/17/14.  Parties review the report prepared by Dr. Deborah Collins dated 1/17/22  and Wisconsin Correction Service Conditional Release Plan dated 4/27/22.  The Court determined that the defendant suffers from a mental illness.  The Court finds that the defendant is not a danger to herself or the community.  The Court ordered the defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Conditional Release until March 26, 2059.  This commitment shall commence on 5/06/22.   The Court ordered the defendant released on the following conditions:
Court ordered defendant shall not have unsupervised contact with any person under the age of 18, defendant shall not act as a caregiver in any capacity for any person under the age of 18 for any period of time. 
Court incorporates the 4/27/22 Wisconsin correctional Service Plan prepared by katie Hettenbach as a condition of release.
The defendant shall submit to random screens as determined by the case manager and the agent.
Order of Conditional Release signed and filed.  The Court did not make a determination regarding medication.  Defendant advised that as a convicted felon she may not possess any firearms.

Attorney Thomas Cotey in court. Defendant Fallon C. Thomas appears by video conference. Elaine B. Fehrs for Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agent also in court. 
Case in court on Petition to Revoke Conditional Release. Statements by all parties.

The court finds that the defendant stipulated that the terms of conditional release were violated and the defendant stipulated to revocation of conditional release. 

The court also finds that the defendant was committed to DHS on 11-17-14 and on 06-11-2019, court determined that conditional release would pose a significant risk of bodily harm to the defendant or others. 

Court ordered conditional release be REVOKED and that placement is institutional care designated by DHS. 

*Court does NOT make a determination as to involuntary medication. 

FILED: CR-275 and CR-276

Defendant Fallon C. Thomas in court with attorney Cynthia M. Wynn.  Defendant Fallon C. Thomas in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State and Defense stipulated to court using reports to make ruling as to defendant's mental responsibility. Testimony from author of the report WAIVED.  Defense advised court defendant wishes to enter a special plea of No Contest due to mental disease or defect. Statements from state and defense counsel. 

PHASE I
Phase I of special plea proceeded. 
AS TO COUNTS 3 & 4
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Counts 3 & 4 Dismissed.
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2
Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead NO CONTEST (by reason of mental disease or defect).   Defendant examined as to the plea.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty, and entered judgment of conviction of Guilty, but not guilty due to mental disease or defect. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended and she may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant will have to provide a DNA sample. Parties wish to proceed to PHASE II.

PHASE II
Received & Filed, Waiver of Jury Trial form. Court held colloquy with defendant regarding her right to a Jury Trial. Court found that the defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED her right to have a Jury Trial. Parties stipulate to Court Trial. Court trial proceeded. State does not offer any witnesses. Court held colloquy with defendant regarding her right to testify and remain silent. Court found that defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED her right to testify. No witnesses for the defense. Received and Filed Defense exhibits #1 & #2 (Doctor's Reports). Court reviewed reports. Arguments from state and defense counsel. For reasons placed on the record court made the following ruling:  Court concluded that the defendant was suffering from a mental defect which prevented the defendant from conforming her behavior to the requirements of the law pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes. Judge found that the defendant is not capable of being released to the community and ordered defendant committed to Wisconsin Department of Health Services. Court ordered defendant confined for institutional care for 45 YEARS as to each count to which the defendant plead NO CONTEST, concurrent to each other with credit for -236 DAYS time served, to be served 25 YEARS of confinement, and 20 YEARS of supervision in the community. In addition, the court finds that the defendant is not competent to refuse medication, and is not eligible for conditional release. Signed & Filed, CR-271 & CR275. Defendant advised of right to seek postconviction relief. Received & Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit form. Received & Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief. Received & Filed, Exhibit List.

Defendant Fallon C. Thomas in court with attorney Cynthia M Wynn.  Defendant Fallon C. Thomas in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Arraignment. Court reviewed Amended Information previously filed by the state, which includes the addition of:
Count 3: Attempt First Degree Intentional Homicide, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.01(1)(a), 939.50(3)(a), 939.32, a class B Felony.
Count 4: Attempt First Degree Intentional Homicide, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.01(1)(a), 939.50(3)(a), 939.32, a class B Felony.
